description: A fatty acid that has been shown to repair gut mucosal barriers and improve the efficacy of anti-TNF-α therapy.
A biological therapy used to treat inflammatory bowel diseases by inhibiting tumor necrosis factor-alpha.
A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
A beneficial bacterium in the gut microbiota that is involved in gut health and metabolism.
Tumor necrosis factor-alpha, a cytokine involved in systemic inflammation and regulation of immune cells.
Interleukin-6, a cytokine that plays a role in inflammation and the immune response.
